alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jackson and northeastern DeKalb Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hollywood, or near Scottsboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Henagar, Stevenson, Hollywood, Skyline, Ider, Pisgah, Martintown, Higdon and Sulpher Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
